articles.content:
DPRK Footballers to Advance into Semi-Finals at AFC under-19 Soccer Championship 
    Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The DPRK team which came second in Group C faced the Iraqi team that placed first in Group D at quarter-finals at AFC under-19 Soccer Championship on November 6.
 The DPRK team beat the Iraqi rival 2:0 and was thus qualified for semi-finals of the championship and, at the same time, for the World under-20 Soccer Championship to be held in Canada in 2007.

Greetings to Cambodian King
articles.content:
Greetings to Cambodian King 
    Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni on the occasion of the 53rd anniversary of the independence of the country.
 The message said that the Korean people sincerely rejoice over the great achievements made by the Cambodian people in their work to defend the independence and sovereignty of the country and develop its national economy under the leadership of the king and the government of Cambodia.    
 Expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Cambodia would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples, the message sincerely wished the king greater success in his noble cause to achieve the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Russian Diplomats Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Russian Diplomats Help Korean Farmers
    Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Andrei Karlov, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of the Russian embassy here drove to the Korea-Russia Friendship Kochang Co-op Farm in Chollima County, South Phyongan Province on Wednesday to help it in farm work.
 They gave helping hands to farmers in rice-threshing on the farm. 
 They handed to the farm aid materials for farming.

articles.title: Folk Street Built at Foot of Mt. Kyongam
articles.content:
Folk Street Built at Foot of Mt. Kyongam
    Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- A folk street has been built at the foot of Mt. Kyongam in Sariwon City, North Hwanghae Province, the DPRK.
 The Kyongam Lake consists of three small lakes along which two roads stretch out 1,000-odd meters each. The city has constructed various shapes of the traditional buildings tinged with national character in the vast areas along the roads.
 The buildings of the street present an ancient picture for their varied colors and decorations in bold relief.    
 There are buildings with hip-saddle roofs including the Mokran Pavilion, Hana Pavilion, Kyongamsan Hotel and History Museum and a gate at an end of the street.
 A merrymaking ground covering more than 5,000 square meters has been built in the street with the Kyongam Pavilion, historical relic belonging to the 15th century, as its center. In the ground, people can conduct art activities and play sports and amusement games.    
 On the left side of the ground, there is a corridor with more than 160 square meters of mosaic murals showing the development process of the national state originated from Kojoson (ancient Korea) and folk customs created in the course. 
 The murals include portraits of celebrated kings and famous patriotic generals including King Tangun, the nation's father, and King Tongmyong, who distinguished themselves in building Korea as a powerful country in the East. And the murals concentrically show customs of the Korean nation according to the 12 months. 
 The walls of the merrymaking ground have pictures showing the old tombs in Kangso, Taedongyo Map and other priceless assets of the nation.
